page.title: 12HOP FARMING IN LYNSTED (1)
page.content: Hops have been grown in this area since 1946. There are approximately 137 acres of high alpha hops suitable for stout beers. The best known types of hops needed are Wye Target, Yeoman, Brewers Gold & Northern Brewer. In March the stringing is done on poles or stilts. This is followed by culti- vation & nutrients are applied to the ground during June, July & August. They spray the hops against aphids & mould. The main spray is called copper. The hop bine should reach the hop wires around the 21st June. The first burrs should appear by the second week in July. Harvesting is in late August through to September. The bines are pulled down by mechanical hop pullers & are taken to the picking shed. The machine shreds the hops & then they are taken to be dried in oast houses.
